Amazon.com Services LLC hiring Data Opti.job_description:
Job Description

Are you interested in applying your strong quantitative analysis and big data skills to world-changing problems? Are you interested in driving the development of methods, models and systems for state-of-the-art operations, transportation, and fulfillment systems? If so, then this is the job for you. The Modelling and Optimization (MOP) team is responsible for developing an in-depth understanding of Amazon's current fulfillment network and designing future networks. This role will also build tools and support structures needed to analyze data, dive deep to determine root cause of system errors, network changes and performance issues. This role will need present findings to business partners to drive improvements and prioritize customer needs to deliver the right results. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS 

 M.S. (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Statistics, Math, Engineering, or related fields; and/or relevant industry experience 

 4+ years of quantitative experience in Logistics/Supply Chain, Transportation, Engineering or related Businesses 

 4+ years of experience with one or more programming languages (e.g. Python, Java, C++, C#, Ruby) 

 4+ years of experience in machine-learning packages (e.g. supervised and unsupervised learning, clustering, random forests, etc...) and/or statistical analysis tools (e.g.: regression analysis, hypothesis testing, time series analysis, etc...) 

 4+ years of experience with data processing technologies: AWS technologies, SQL, data pipelines, etc... 

 4+ years of experience with large-scale data: extracting, processing, analyzing, and representing large quantities of data (e.g.: millions to billions of records) PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 

 Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Math, Engineering, or related fields 

 6+ years of quantitative experience in Logistics/Supply Chain, Transportation, Engineering or related Businesses 

 6+ years of experience with one or more programming languages (e.g. Python, Java, C++, C#, Ruby) 

 6+ years of experience in machine-learning packages (e.g. supervised and unsupervised learning, clustering, random forests, etc...) and/or statistical analysis tools (e.g.: regression analysis, hypothesis testing, time series analysis, etc...) 

 6+ years of experience with data processing technologies: AWS technologies, SQL, data pipelines, etc... 

 6+ years of experience with large-scale data: extracting, processing, analyzing, and representing large quantities of data (e.g.: millions to billions of records)

This role will need present findings to business partners to drive improvements and prioritize customer needs to deliver the right results. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS 

 M.S. (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Statistics, Math, Engineering, or related fields; and/or relevant industry experience

 4+ years of experience in machine-learning packages (e.g. supervised and unsupervised learning, clustering, random forests, etc...) and/or statistical analysis tools (e.g.: regression analysis, hypothesis testing, time series analysis, etc...) 

 4+ years of experience with data processing technologies: AWS technologies, SQL, data pipelines, etc... 

 4+ years of experience with large-scale data: extracting, processing, analyzing, and representing large quantities of data (e.g.: millions to billions of records) PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Powerlink hiring Network Applications En.job_description:
What's On Offer

Powerlink Queensland, Queensland’s high voltage transmission network provider, currently has an exciting career opportunity for an experienced Network Applications Engineer in a fixed term capacity for up to 36 months.

Support significant transformational changes in our transmission network and systems

Help us introduce next generation technology in our Energy Management System

Prepare our operational network and systems for the future

About The Role

You will deliver 24 x 7 support of complex real-time applications critical to maintain Powerlink’s Energy Management System (EMS); including Network Analysis, Power Systems Simulator (PSS) and SCADA applications.

You Will Also Be Involved In

The planning, design and delivery of business solutions for Powerlink’s Energy/Digital/Telecommunications Network Management Systems (NMS).

Supporting the introduction of new technologies, systems and best practice in the field of high voltage (HV) energy management operations, and data analysis.

About You

You will have Tertiary qualification(s) in Electrical or Electronics Engineering, or Information Technology. Working as part of a team, you will have experience developing software solutions to problems involving large and complex data sets in a high availability environment within the Electricity Industry.

In addition you will be able to demonstrate experience in:

at least two scripting languages, python and shell scripting preferred;

modern server operating systems in a high availability environment, Red Hat Linux 8 and Windows Server 2016;

C programming fundamentals, ideally in a Linux development environment;

working with large data sets, manipulating data structures, producing analysis and reports;

an engineering environment, ideally with knowledge of Power System fundamentals.

We would like to hear from you if you recognise yourself in the above and below:

a self-starter;

who is pro-active in figuring out the best way to solve complex problems; 

has good Power Systems understanding;

can take a concept, and develop a solution from prototype to final implementation;

can convert complex technical data and information into clear and concise communication.

About Powerlink

Powerlink and its predecessor companies have been helping to keep the lights on in Queensland for more than 50 years – powering the State’s economy and enriching lifestyles. Our people strategy is focused on balanced leadership, values diverse backgrounds and fosters a culture of inclusion.

What next?

What’s Next

To apply please click on the Apply Now button and submit a covering letter, an updated resume and answer the application questions. You will need to submit an application by 

Midnight Sunday 16 August 2020

. Please monitor your e-mail for further communication regarding the progress of your application.

For further information please contact the Powerlink recruitment team on recruitment@powerlink.com.au.

More About Us

At Powerlink, we are an equal opportunity employer and proud to be a Work180 Endorsed Employer for Women. We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.

IBM hiring Research Scientist - Health A.job_description:
Introduction

From landing the first astronauts on the moon to building the first cognitive system to win Jeopardy! IBM with its diverse culture, continues to be the innovative spark of the computing revolutions that shape our world. At the core of IBM’s innovation are its 12 global research labs. IBM Research Australia is a young, proud and diverse community working on industry solutions, conceiving, designing and building next generation enterprise systems.

Your Role and Responsibilities

 Research Scientist - Health AI Postdoc Researcher – Melbourne 

Offered on a 24months fixed term hire employment basis.

Compensation package from $96,750 (full-time equivalent inclusive of superannuation) and will be determined based on successful candidate’s relevant skills and experience.

The IBM Research - Australia Lab is seeking postdoctoral researchers to join its Epilepsy Research Team.

Candidates will be joining a team of researchers and software engineers to conceive, research, build, test and deploy solutions for some of the world’s most challenging technology problems. This will include generating highly novel ideas for research, evaluation, implementation and productization. Suitable candidates will have varied backgrounds and experiences for algorithm/application development, and theoretical understanding.

The ideal candidate should possess a doctorate in computer science, medical informatics, engineering, biostatistics or other related fields, with a demonstrated track record of developing advanced statistics, machine and deep learning, data mining or computational modelling techniques to solving real world health problems. The candidate should have a proven publication record and the ability to carry out world-class research. The candidate will be expected to disseminate, both internally and externally, the results of their activities through publications in world-class journals, patent disclosures, top-tier conferences, seminars, and as part of client interactions. The candidate will represent IBM at professional meetings, in professional societies and universities and keep technically abreast of the literature and progress within their specific and related areas of expertise.

 Ideal candidates will have expertise in several of the following areas: 

 Must have: Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Pattern Recognition, Statistical Learning, or Probabilistic Graphical Models 

 Must have: Python and deep learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow or PyTorch 

 Must have: developing, testing, and deploying systems for analysing medical data such as for example EEG, ECG, text, speech or imaging data, or for other real-world applications 

 Software maintenance and source control, eg Git will be a good plus. 

 Treatment, diagnosis and management of neurological disorders with a special focus on epilepsy will be a good plus. 

 Experience in computational neuroscience and neural modelling will be a good plus.

 Required Technical and Professional Experience: 

 Required Education: Doctorate Degree 

 Proven experience in machine learning 

 Proven experience in deep learning 

 Published papers in high quality peer-reviewed journals/conferences such as for example ECCV, PAMI, IJCAI, MICCAI, ICLR, NeurlPS, ECAI, or AAAI 

 English: Fluent 

To Apply

Upload your CV, cover letter, academic transcript and your Right to Work in Australia document. A competitive compensation package will be determined based on successful candidates’ relevant skills and experience.

 EO Statement 

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

 As above

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise

 As above

About Business Unit

With more than 3,000 researchers in 12 labs located across six continents, IBM Research brings together hundreds of researchers who possess unparalleled industry expertise to address some of the world's most challenging problems. Join us as we do pioneering work in areas such as cognitive computing, augmented intelligence, quantum computing, and blockchain, to name a few.

Your Life @ IBM

IBM Research is looking for Postdoctoral research candidates to fill a position in our Health Care and Life Sciences and Financial Services teams. We focus on designing and developing novel AI techniques, including using NLP, to health care and related industries. The team is proactive both in publishing our work in top academic conferences as well as demonstrating its value with clients. The focus of the postdoctoral researcher will be on developing neural language models and publishing the outcomes in top academic conferences.

About IBM

With more than 3,000 researchers in 12 labs located across six continents, IBM Research brings together hundreds of researchers who possess unparalleled industry expertise to address some of the world's most challenging problems. Join us as we do pioneering work in areas such as cognitive computing, augmented intelligence, quantum computing, and blockchain, to name a few.

Location Statement

For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

Being You @ IBM

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

We’ve developed a 3D bioprinting and biomaterials platform through years of fundamental research, and are now working with world-leading scientists and clinicians to accelerate biological discoveries and advance regenerative medicine programs. 

Join a fast-growing and innovative biotech startup with a dynamic team combining expertise in biology, chemistry, engineering, medicine, computer science and more. We are unified by a great purpose and committed to a vibrant culture that supports talented people to contribute to building a company they can be truly proud of. 

We are seeking an experienced, creative, and highly-motivated scientist with a very strong background in 3D bioprinting technology to join us in advancing our ground-breaking technology platform.

Responsibilities

Design, plan, carry out and analyse experiments as part of the Application Science team

Drive aspects of our 3D Bioprinting development within an interdisciplinary environment

Stay up to date with developments in 3D bioprinting technology to guide new developmental paths

Support assay development and develop downstream analysis from prototype to final product

Qualifications

﻿

Required

1+ years project management experience in a biotechnology company within an R&D setting 

3+ years of experience in development of 3D bioprinting hardware, with a strong preference for drop on demand printing technology

Expertise in a diversity of 3D bioprinting technologies with in depth knowledge of printing cell-containing substances

Expertise in study design, advanced data analysis via python, and communicating results to multidisciplinary teams

Strong teamwork with evidence of self-driven initiative 

MSc degree in a relevant discipline

Strong 3D cell culture experience 

Experience in training and supervising other laboratory members

Apply Now

Fallon Solutions hiring Full Stack Deve.job_description:
We are building an end-to-end SaaS platform for the market leader in trade services ahead of commercialising the platform for the broader market.

We are looking for an experienced Full Stack Developer to join our expanding Platform team to bring modern user-experience and data solutions to the trade services industry. You will help design, architect, build and automate software applications that delight users and business owners. 

How you will make an impact

Build and deploy high-quality features and applications that solve problems for our customers

Ensure reliability and efficiency of the platform by deploying infrastructure as code

Write clear, expressive and modular code so that others can easily collaborate or extend the platform

Employ effective testing strategies across multiple devices and OS versions to deliver reliable products to our customers

Contribute to solution design for new features and enhancements to the platform

Actively maintain our web applications and microservices during the full life cycle including measuring, monitoring, testing and support

Take ownership and lead the analysis and resolution of issues, crashes and bugs

Contribute to the product and engineering roadmap and company success

 

What’s our technology stack?

Amazon Web Services (AWS)

Serverless architecture making heavy use of Lambda (Typescript)

Heavy use of DynamoDB, Elasticsearch, S3, Cognito and CloudWatch

iOS app in Swift + SwiftUI

Web app in React (Typescript)

API layer using GraphQL (AWS AppSync)

Infrastructure as code deployed with AWS CDK

CI/CD with CodePipeline

Required from you

4+ years of front-end web development experience (HTML, CSS and JS)

4+ years of experience in back-end web development experience (Node.js, Python, C#, Java or equivalent)

2+ years of experience in Node.js

Experience building, deploying and managing React apps

Experience building, deploying and managing APIs for React and mobile app

Experience working with a cloud deployed architecture

Proven support of a web app through the entire life cycle including deployment, measuring, monitoring, testing and support

Excellent communication skills and productive, positive team player

Experience working with an Agile methodology

Australian residents only

Desired

Experience with AWS management and deployment

Experience with Typescript

Experience with serverless architectures and designing, building and managing microservices

Experience with Infrastructure as Code (e.g. AWS CDK, CloudFormation, Terraform)

Proficiency with Elasticsearch and Kibana

Experience with GraphQL

Native mobile development experience (Swift, Java)

Solid understanding of UI design principles, mobile UI conventions and responsive design techniques

Experience in BI design and development, data modelling and data architecture

Experience with Extract Transform & Load (ETL) development with ability to code in python and/or javascript/typescript

Experience in Field Service or Logistics industries

The Company

Celebrating over 55 years in business,

 Fallon Solutions

 provide a wide range of services including air conditioning, electrical, TV and data, plumbing, gas fitting, carpentry and other trade services.  

Fallon Solutions employs over 150 permanent staff and use a number of trusted specialist fully accredited contractors when necessary. Fallon Solutions have a fleet of 100 service vehicles servicing the greater Brisbane area and the Gold Coast.

Fallon Solutions ensures that all staff are fully trained in their trade and in all aspects of safety. Staff receive regular opportunities to cross skill into other areas.

Our company culture

We deliver WOW through Service Excellence

We are one team, with a positive, fun & family spirit

We sometimes make mistakes, but learn from them and do not make them again

We embrace new ways to improve

We look for exceptional outcomes for our customers, employees and our company

We pursue growth & learning to help create success for all

We recognise & reward success

We build real relationships with open & honest communication

We are proud to share who we are and what we achieve

Apply now!

If you want to advance your career, join a progressive business, work with a team that has a strong positive, fun, family spirit, and share in our success, we want you to apply.

Only those applicants who provide a covering letter will be considered.

Please note: A pre-employment police check and medical are mandatory requirements of placement in this position.

﻿

Australian residents only

For more information on Fallon Solutions, visit our website www.fallonsolutions.com.au

Jobs Interviewing Now from MJH hiring So.job_description:
Are you interested in building hyper-scale services in the cloud? Are you interested in embarking the journey of building the next generation database systems and creating an impact on its hundreds of thousands of users? Do you want to work with world-class, state-of-the-art technologies on a fun, diverse, rapidly growing team in sunny Sydney, Australia? Then you want to join the AWS Redshift engineering team in Sydney!

Amazon Redshift is a fast, fully managed, petabyte-scale data warehouse that makes it simple and cost-effective to analyse all your data using your existing business intelligence tools

As a Software Development Engineer with Amazon Redshift in Sydney, you will have the opportunity to invent, design and implement system architecture of AWS Redshift at Amazon scale. You will have significant influence on our overall strategy by helping define impactful product features, drive the system architecture, and spearhead the best practices that enable a quality product. You will work on the Redshift cloud platform to improve the technologies that orchestrate and manage Redshift clusters globally. You will build out automation of critical operational functions that ensure thousands of servers across multiple data centers worldwide maintain lights on.

The ideal candidate for this role dives into ambiguous problem spaces and meticulously distills out design choices, trade-offs, and priorities. This person demonstrates exceptional technical expertise, a sound understanding of the fundamentals of Computer Science, and practical experience building large-scale distributed systems. We seek someone who is data and metric driven, and is obsessively concerned about performance under resource constrained environments.

This is a unique and rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor within a fast-growing business and help shape the technology, product and the business. A successful candidate will bring deep technical, networking and coding expertise with the ability to work within a fast moving, startup environment in a large company to deliver a broad business impact.

Come, join us in reinventing database systems for the cloud!

Basic Qualifications

 8+ years of professional experience in a software environment, developing high quality code.

 Proficient in at least one or more object-oriented programming language: Java, Python, Ruby, Go, C++ or Kotlin.

 Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design and complexity analysis.

 Built systems that scale through software, owned and defined the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns and reliability)

 Experience in communicating with peers, technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements & describe software product features, technical designs, and product strategy.

 Have mentored software engineers to help improve their skills, efficiency and productivity.

 Experience in improving process and applying best practices for a whole project/team with solid expertises of software development life cycle; including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.

 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent.

 Excellent written and verbal communication skills

 Strong willingness to make a difference.

Preferred Qualifications

 Distributed computing and large-scale systems, taking a leading role in building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers.

 Exposure to large-scale distributed storage and database systems (e.g. SQL, NoSQL, Graph Databases)

 Delivered software in an environment that utilises Agile methodologies like SCRUM or Kanban.

 Hand on experience with AWS services such as RDS, EC2, Dynamo DB, CloudWatch.

 Masters in Computer Science or equivalent.

Teachers Mutual Bank Limited hiring Cybe.job_description:
Excellent opportunity for an experienced Cyber Security Analyst to join an Award-winning Bank!

We’ve got some exciting growth and transformation plans for our business and have been investing in our cyber Security capability to support this. We are now looking to appoint a Cyber Security Analyst to continue that journey.

About Us

Teachers Mutual Bank Limited (TMBL) is one of Australia’s largest values based, member-owned financial institutions. Part of our profits go back to members through competitive, award-winning products as well as towards sustainable business practices that benefit the environment and wider communities we serve. Members can join us through one of four unique brands, each focused on some of Australia’s key essential service sectors including teaching, universities, fire and emergency and health. Employees who work for our bank embrace the core values of passion, advocacy and sustainability and contribute to a diverse and inclusive workplace culture founded on mutual respect, equality and a focus on delivering exceptional member service.

About The Role

As our Cyber Security Analyst you will be involved in a wide range of security initiatives across the bank, be responsible for working with internal stakeholders to secure existing and incoming technology solutions, and have the freedom to make real change.

You will work as a member of the IT Security team to support the implementation of key security controls and support TMBL top-down to support new initiatives and change.

This role will be hands-on-tools, supporting the implementation and effective management of security controls that protect the organisation from Information Security threats.

You will be instrumental in maintaining acute awareness of the threat actors to the organisation and have a structured approach to measure the organisation’s exposure, and therefore risk and control requirements.

About You

To be successful in this role, you will have:

Extensive relevant Cyber Security experience

Experience with scripting languages (Python, PowerShell) automation

Knowledge/experience with common security tools and assessment requirements (E.g SIEM, Endpoint Security, WAF, DLP, Threat hunting, Threat Intelligence, Security Incident investigations, Code Review, Data, Application and API security)

One or more relevant security certifications (e.g. CEH, CISSP, SANS, GIAC certificates, cloud-specific security certifications, OSCP)

In-depth Cyber security knowledge across a broad range of topics

Experience working in SOC would be added advantage.

 You are a collaborative team player with outstanding communication skills and strong stakeholder management capabilities. You can quickly understand and breakdown complex problems, systems architectures, and technologies and efficiently translate technical issues and risks into business language for internal stakeholders.

If you are a quick learner, passionate about technology and keen to explore the world of Cyber Security, this may be the perfect opportunity for you!

To be considered for this opportunity, please submit a resume and cover letter telling us why you think you would be perfect for this role. Closing date for applications is 

Thursday, 13 August 2020

. Recruitment agency submissions not accepted, thank you.

Support Applications in a predominantly serverless environment, working with exciting tech stack & great team, amazing customer Apps in a retail env.

About Us

Here at 

craveable brands.

 we operate over 570 restaurants across 3 iconic Australian chicken brands; Red Rooster, Oporto and Chicken Treat. Combined, our restaurants hire over 12,500 employees and serve over 150,000 customers a day. It’s safe to say we’re cooking

Business Systems' primary objective is to equip our brands with technology that allows them to delight our customers at every opportunity. This is achieved through best in breed digital platforms, technical infrastructure and support offerings. Out IT department are a close knit, cross functional team which presents our staff with exposure to a wide variety of growth opportunities. To attract and retain the talent necessary to achieve organizational goals, our department aims to foster a culture of teamwork, enthusiasm, innovation, professional development and most importantly, a real love of our brands.

About The Gig

As the 

Customer Facing Applications Manager

 you will be reporting to the Head of IT Operations. Utilising your expertise and knowledge, you will deliver and maintain awesome digital platforms to drive convenience. 

So how will you be helping 3 of 

most loved Restaurant Brands in Australia?

 You will maintain the lifecycle of the digital applications supporting franchise partners and direct consumers.

You will 

own and drive continuous improvement

 through people capability, process optimisation and technology improvements as well as mange the product lifecycle for our applications to maintain currency for function and availability. 

You are crucial

 to the maintenance of administration tasks for digital platforms including online ordering platforms, Salesforce CRM, loyalty and brand websites. Also, you will build and maintain positive working relationships with partners as well as key stakeholders such as Brand Operations, Brand Marketing, and the Technical team to ensure that 

We Win Together.

About You

Ideally you will have 3 years plus experience with lifecycle management of customer facing applications with previous experience in QSR or FMCG being advantageous. Knowledge of AWS cloud ecosystem (ideally AWS Solutions Architect associate certification or higher) would be preferred as well as working knowledge of serverless event driven computing (SQS, SNS, Lambda, API gateway), coupled with Javascript/NodeJS, and/or Python would be ideal.

Your ability to apply your detailed expertise and technology while having to adapt to change and accept new ideas will be essential to this role. While you analyse information and produce solutions, you must act with integrity and ethics as well as present and communicate clearly and show the credibility of your work.

If you 

are passionate about providing outstanding customer experience through digital platforms

 as well as supporting various stakeholders, then this is the role for you.

About Our Culture & Benefits

If you are someone who thrives working in an entrepreneurial, hands on team environment and would like to join a dynamic, fun and progressive organisation then this is an excellent opportunity for you. We have a focus on work/life balance and are committed to making it work for you. We offer:

Extra day of leave in your birthday month

Purchased annual leave, up to 2 weeks

We encourage work/life balance and for you to take full advantage of the summer months through our Summer Working Hours offering!

Being out and about in our stores is important to us, so have some food on us and give us your honest opinion

Discounted gym membership

Paid Good Deed (volunteering) 2 days

Discounted health insurance and health products

Flexible working arrangements

 

Hungry to Hear More? 

Submit your interest by including your resume and a cover letter telling us a little more about yourself.

is an EEO employer and promotes diversity in the workplace.

At Liveli, we help customers leverage the power of location intelligence in their business with easy-to-use mapping products and scalable Cloud technology. We are passionate about helping businesses solve their business problems. Our philosophy – People Partnership Success – reflects the way we approach our business. The expertise of our people, the long-term client relationships we form, the active participation within your industry and the strategic partnerships we have created over 25 years, demonstrates that we invest in relationships for the long term.

In this role you will have the opportunity to advance your career with long-term career pathways, on-going customised Google skills training and exceptional learning opportunities. You will be joining a vibrant team of professionals who have an enthusiasm for creative problem solving while learning new skills on a daily basis.

This role shall be working directly with the Liveli and Google teams throughout the region, working with some of the largest and most disruptive companies in enhancing their business using Google Cloud technologies.

Responsibilities

Become a Google subject matter expert with specialised technology experience in Google Cloud solutions for Data Analytics, API Management, Data Warehouse Modernization, Real-time data streaming, IoT and Machine Learning. Google Cloud training and accreditation will be provided.

Support sales and account management teams by providing technical expertise, in order to promote and support the location intelligence product offerings of the company, primarily established from cloud platforms and geospatial mapping technologies.

Identify and understand complex customer requirements on both a business and technical level through development and execution of technical discovery workshops.

Provide leadership to both customers and internal sales staff in navigating the technology/product landscape in order to meet requirements and use cases.

Build and execute product and technology demonstrations to new and existing customers.

Respond to customer requests for proposals and develop designs for highly performant, scalable, secure, robust and cost-effective solutions.

Lead and drive opportunities through the entire business cycle, working with other customer engineers and cross-functional teams as necessary.

Build and maintain relationships with customers, influence long-term strategic direction and provide thought leadership.

Be well-versed in selling Google’s portfolio of products and services and keep up with new technologies entering the market.

Collaborate and provide knowledge transfer to implementation teams.

Contribute to application development and delivery projects as required.

Your successful qualities

Interested in continuous learning and personal growth.

Able to bring creativity and resourcefulness in order to solve problems.

Self motivated and willing to take on responsibility.

Friendly and have an outgoing personality.

Interested in keeping up with new technologies, products and trends. Curious to understand how they may correlate to customer requirements.

Confident in communicating and maintaining relationships with customers. Willing to present your own ideas and stand by them.

Collaborative and open-minded within your team.

Skills

BSc degree or equivalent practical experience.

2 years of technology sales experience, providing cloud computing solutions.

Excellent English communication skills.

Hands on experience with at least one programming language - .NET, NodeJS, Java, Python.

Knowledge of database and storage products and technologies.

Understanding of front-end web development frameworks - Angular, React.

Experience in designing, building and consuming REST APIs.

Desirable

Understanding of concepts such as application containerization and serverless architectures.

An understanding of what Machine Learning is and what technologies exist.

Understanding of data engineering concepts - data storage formats, data processing techniques, data pipelines, analytics.

Experience designing, building and hosting Cloud Native solutions on GCP, Azure or AWS.

GIS experience

This position is open to all levels who love to try new things, are passionate about business and technology, thrive on responsibility and want more than just a job but also the opportunity to be part of a fun and active

team and push the boundaries of innovation.

DeployPartners hiring Linux System Admi.job_description:
Overview

Background The Land Network Integration Centre (LNIC) within Army Headquarters has been tasked to design and certify a Mission Partner Environment (MPE) solution for the Headquarters On-The-Move (HQOTM) capability to be delivered by Land Project 2072 Phase 2B. The services delivered within the HQOTM vehicle will be required to interface into the existing MPE system and must be compliant with the Vehicle Standard Operating Environment.

The solution needs to support two users whilst moving, with potential for additional users while static and will have constrained WAN access through the use of disadvantaged TDMA SATCOM links. The HQOTM MPE node will have interfaces to tactical command and control services within the vehicle, accessing tactical radio networks. The LNIC has established a small project team to commence work on the task and now requires the services of a Linux System Administrator to augment the team.

The LNIC is based in Canberra with a small number of personnel working remotely from Brisbane. Therefore, LNIC are seeking Canberra or Brisbane based personnel to fulfil the role. Scope The LNIC is seeking an individual with broad Linux-based system administration experience. The successful candidate will be responsible for installing, configuring and maintaining Linux servers within the HQOTM node. This will involve: 

 Reviewing and providing advice on the design and implementation of the HQOTM node. 

 Installing and configuring Linux components within the node. 

 Performing system maintenance and resolving server-side issues. 

 Managing, coordinating, and implementing software upgrades, patches and hotfixes. 

 Creating and modifying scripts or applications to perform specified tasks. 

 Transferring knowledge to support personnel. 

 Contributing to training material development.

Requirements

Security clearance

Must have a current negative vetting level 1 security clearance and be prepared to obtain a negative vetting level 2 clearance.

Essential Criteria

Greater than 5 years of Linux system administration experience.

In depth knowledge of Linux CentOS and Fedora

Experience with KVM and Openstack vitualisation technologies.

Experience with Kubernetes and Docker containerisation.

Experience with Shell, Perl, and/or Python scripting.

Solid knowledge of protocols such as DNS, HTTP, FreeIPA, SMTP, XMPP, Postfix(MTA), Dovecot and SNMP.

Experience with public key infrastructure (PKI).

Ability to provide technical advice to meet business requirements.

Desirable criteria

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or similar relevant degree.

Linux certifications such as RHCT, RHCE and LPIC.

Experience working with deployable military communications and information systems.

Experience working within agile project management frameworks.

Experience with DEVOPS methodologies.

Eden Ritchie Recruitment hiring Data Eng.job_description:
Eden Ritchie is seeking an experienced Data Engineer for an initial 4-6-month contract with a possible extension, working within a state government organisation, this role will be based in their Brisbane's Inner Northern Suburb office.

Demonstrated experience in data engineering with a focus on analytics in the context of a large scale, complex business change program, you will be required to have a track record in the manipulation, processing and extracting value from large, decoupled datasets, with attention to detail in data quality, wrangling, cleansing and validation.

The Successful Candidate Will Be Responsible For

Designing, implementing, optimising and managing core data infrastructure on cloud platforms (e.g. Azure) with an emphasis on security and reliability. This includes data migration.

Developing, implementing and managing application and user access for the core data infrastructure in accordance with Data Governance Frameworks and/or policies.

Managing data infrastructure in a CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Development) pipeline with appropriate controls and documentation.

Building and sustaining multiple ingestion pipelines with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) tools as per defined business and user requirements with an emphasis on quality.

Designing and implementing data pipeline and reporting processes, including automation where required (e.g. Azure Automation).

Defining processes or options for deploying and integrating new features/capabilities on to the core data infrastructure platform.

Providing strategic and operational advice on transformational program/project direction for data engineering activities, including infrastructure build, which meets business requirements and is of high quality.

Working with the Business Analyst and/or other stakeholders to deliver outcomes which provide value to the business and align with the department's strategy across the project.

Developing handover documentation and ongoing support models, including architecture diagrams.

Validation of infrastructure and models in a test environment and commissioning onto production platforms.

Assisting with the planning and coordination of ICT integration testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and providing support to business stakeholders to achieve successful UAT outcomes.

Creating analytics tools, data marts and reports which can be used to build/optimise products for stakeholders across the business using Microsoft BI technologies such as Azure, SQL Server, Power BI, Excel etc.

Key Accountabilities Of The Role

Extensive demonstrated experience in data engineering, with a focus on analytics in the context of a large scale, complex business change program/project. Public sector experience is desired but not essential.

Demonstrated track record of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large, decoupled datasets, with attention to detail in data quality, wrangling, cleansing and validation.

Demonstrated experience collaborating with project/business stakeholders to understand their goals and objectives, and fully clarify their needs.

Knowledge of, and experience in applying, waterfall and agile project methodologies (e.g. PRINCE2 Agile) in cross- functional teams within a dynamic environment.

Required technical skills:

 

Extensive experience in setup, migration and management of Data Warehouses in the Cloud (e.g. Azure).

Advanced skills in Microsoft SQL and Python scripting.

Data mart setup based on use cases.

 

Desirable technical skills:

 

Power BI report creation and secure sharing.

Advanced skill in NoSQL.

 for further information.

CMD Solutions

 in less than 10 words it would be, hands down, that we live and breathe AWS. We’re passionate about the latest tech and finding the best solutions for our clients - all built on AWS. About CMD Solutions?

 A utomate, Innovate and Transform 

. This drives our passion to deliver advanced and sophisticated AWS data solutions that lead the industry. We harness the power of AWS to deliver infrastructure as code, in a pure DevOps, CI/CD methodology and build innovative data solutions for our clients.

What You Can Expect From Us

The opportunity to work closely with AWS technologies; CMD is a AWS Premier Consulting Partner

Continued professional development - we will support your learning and certifications from day one

Career progression throughout the business and our sister companies; DigIO, Eliiza & Kasna

We hire smart people and get out of their way. By focusing on our five principles and not getting caught up in red tape, we trust you to get the job done

About IP Optical Networks

Our IP/Optical Networks business group (ION) includes IP, optical and network automation technologies and related services sold to our communication service provider customers as well as adjacent markets including webscale companies and enterprises. Our comprehensive wide area networking (WAN) solutions enable our customers to build and operate automated, secure, and high-performance networks at massive scale – helping to interconnect people and things from any broadband access modality to – and among - edge clouds, central clouds, the Internet, and other services and data centers.

Job Description

 Responsibilities: 

Pre-sales Phase

 ASSIST Business Development with the following: 

 Development of the ION Architecture and Solution Description to be used for offer submission (and integration/dependencies with the E2E solution). 

 Pre-determine a Physical and Logical Solution Architecture; partition and allocate system requirements and functionality to the architecture; analyse and evaluate alternative solutions; define subsystems and system elements and requirements. 

 Identification of Key Technical Risks and Issues, develop mitigation plans 

 Identification of roadmap gates ensuring time to market (for ION products and dependencies with non- ION and non-Nokia products). 

 Provide key inputs for technical decisions relating to system requirements and system architecture/design. 

Project Execution Phase

 System/Solution Requirements Development. 

 Identification of key Use Cases; agreement on key acceptance criteria.

 Development of E2E Solution Architecture and support to High-Level Design (multiple technology domains). 

 Determine a Physical and Logical Solution Architecture; partition and allocate system requirements and functionality to the architecture; analyse and evaluate alternation solutions; define subsystems and system elements and requirements.

 Review HLD/LLD/Interface Specification 

 Proactively seek to identify and address technical risks. In co-operation with the PM/TPM conduct risk assessments on the project and all suppliers; identifying and executing mitigation strategies to limit impact; support on reporting of risk exposure (cost, schedule, other); escalating, as appropriate. 

 Review roadmap alignment with solution to be implemented with PLM engagement. 

 Technical aspects of Gate & Milestone Execution. 

 Provide key inputs and be accountable for technical decisions relating to system requirements and system architecture/design. 

 Requirements & Design traceability. 

 Maintain traceability between requirement sets (Customer, System, Subsystems and System Elements), maintain traceability to architecture and design documents; support traceability to verification activities. 

 Technical change impact assessment end to end (both internal & 3 rd party). 

 The Solution Architect is accountable for the technical accuracy of the design solution (i.e.: as defined in the SA&HLD etc.) – and the resulting implementation. 

 The Solution Architect assists with technical delivery of the end-to-end project – design implementation to acceptance. 

 Technical support, manage, review 3rd party suppliers and vendors - including:

 Ensuring that all parties involved in the solution development (SI project team, the customer, 3rd party suppliers, subsystem design teams) clearly understood their technical scope/objectives (through document reviews, workshops, presentations, informal Q&A)

 Reviewing and assessing the technical progress of all suppliers – including 3rd Parties.

 Solution Architecture and Description, Technical Scope of Work. 

 Requirement needs. 

 Inputs for HLD and Project Plan. 

 Risks & Mitigations. 

 Assist with roadmap alignment/gaps escalated to PLM. 

Develop reference architecture for Services Library if project is first of kind

 Skills

 Detailed understanding of 3GPP interfaces, IP/MPLS concepts and related technologies

Technologies/Products

Social Skills (behavior, Attitude, Language Knowledge, …)

Cash App is the fastest growing financial brand in the world. Initially built to take the pain out of peer-to-peer payments, Cash App has gone from a simple product with a single purpose to a dynamic app with over 24 million monthly active users. We are bringing a better way to send, spend, invest, and save to anyone who has ever sought an alternative to the traditional banking system.

Loved by customers and pop culture, we’ve consistently held the top spot for finance in the App Store for many years, seeing more engagement with millions of followers across social media in a day than most brands see in a year. We are building an ecosystem to redefine the world’s relationship with money by making it universally accessible.

We want to hire the best talent regardless of location. Our employment model is distributed, offering the opportunity to collaborate with teams across the world in San Francisco, New York, St. Louis, Portland, Toronto, Kitchener-Waterloo, Sydney, and Melbourne.

Interested in learning more?

Job Description

At Cash App we believe Machine Learning, especially Deep Learning powered Artificial Intelligence, is the future. Our mission is to make them available in the present. To achieve this we’re organised into three teams: ML Platform, Data Infrastructure & Risk.

We believe each Machine Learning Engineer has a diverse set of skills, regardless of what your strength is, we would love to talk to you!

Problems You’d Be Solving

 Prototype new approaches and productionize solutions at scale for our 24+ millions of active users 

 Help execute our long-term Machine Learning strategy across Cash App 

 Create a world class platform for training, hosting and maintaining ML models ' 

 Identify opportunities for platformization by communicating with our applied ML team 

 Balance the needs of Product, Data Scientists, User Research, and other engineers in a small team to develop machine learning approaches that advance our mission to detect fraud 

You Have

Qualifications

7+ years industry experience 

 Demonstrated technical initiative and leadership on previous projects 

 Managed large projects from inception to exicution 

 The ability to work in a fast paced, autonomous and unpredictable environment 

 Desire to mentor & grow other machine learning engineers across the org to further these efforts 

 A deep understanding of software that allows you make the right trade offs 

 Natural curiosity & eagerness to learn (we have one day a week dedicated to Passion Projects)

Technologies We Use

We’re agnostic to what you know walking in the door. You’ll need to be happy working with:

 Kotlin, Java, Go & Python 

 AWS 

 Kafka, Beam and Flink 

Additional Information

Cash App treats all employees and job applicants equally. Every decision is based on merit,

, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Woolworths Group hiring Business Analyst.job_description:
Business Analyst

 About WooliesX

As a start-up business inside one of Australia's largest retailers, WooliesX aims to bring the best of Woolworths to our customers, powered by our team, technology and data. To achieve our customer 1st strategy, we have combined the Digital, eCommerce, Customer Loyalty and Financial Services businesses to transform the customer experience under one banner - WooliesX.

Based between Bella Vista and Surry Hills, our vibrant, innovative and energetic collaboration spaces empower our teams to innovate and deliver an exceptional experience for our customers - no matter whether they choose to shop in-store, or online.

We are an agile team who embrace diversity of thought and love to take on challenges with a pragmatic and innovative approach. Our culture thrives on mutual respect, care, curiosity, openness, and a proactive attitude. As a team we continually seek ways to pair, collaborate, support and learn from each other!

 About The Role

As Business Analyst, you are responsible for investigating business situations, identifying options for improvement and defining requirements to deliver business improvements. You will understand the way the business works today and identify opportunities for improvement through analysis, insights and development of commercial and operational solutions.

Provide general decision support analysis as and when required by the management team

Develop daily, weekly and monthly reporting & insights across operational, team and customer outcomes.

Build and visualise essential insights and storyboarding to engage audience of varied seniority

Move quickly to engage others in operational decisions 

Ensure that analysis is accurate, well documented and clearly presented

 About You

To be a successful Business Analyst, you must be a methodical, highly numerate and disciplined thinker who can manipulate complex data sets and create meaningful analytic models and insights, engaging and have the ability to maintain strong relationships with stakeholders. You are proactive and able to identify gaps in data and processes and can maintain stable performance under pressure. You also have the ability to challenge the status quo and existing assumptions in order to promote innovative thinking and new solutions. In addition:

Previous retail and operational experience or FMCG is advantageous

Minimum 4-5 years experience in Business Analytics

I WORK FOR SA hiring Member Insights Lea.job_description:
Super SA is a branch of the Department of Treasury and Finance (DTF). Operating for more than 100 years, Super SA proudly services South Australian Public Sector employees. We are a member-centric fund, administering the super accounts for more than 200,000 members.

About The Role

The Member Insights Lead will analyse business intelligence data, member voice and research to provide strategic insights to drive and influence decision making and the performance of Super SA. In this role, you will:

Understand member data to proactively identify insights, opportunities for member retention and to maximise member engagement

Identify opportunities to drive member value through changes in member behaviour as a result of enhanced financial advice and education offerings

Identify trends and opportunities through the analysis of complex data sets using quantitative methods such as predictive modelling, multi-variate analysis, churn prediction and regression analysis

Create and maintain rich interactive visualisations through data interpretation and analysis, integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources, including the set up and monitoring of data sharing agreements

Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources and build scripts to make data evaluation more flexible and scalable across data sets.

Assist with development of data governance framework including data definitions tables to align with industry standards

What We're Looking For

To be successful in the role, you will have:

Strong capability to use data, information and performance analysis to support strategic and tactical decision making

Ability to link operational activities with organisational strategy and demonstrate a clear understanding of strategic direction

Demonstrated experience performing complex descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and preventative analyses

Experience analysing large and diverse data sets, including structured and unstructured data, with a query language such as SQL

Experience using statistical coding languages including one or more of Python, R language

Experience in data mining, modelling, statistical analysis, business intelligence gathering, trending and bench-marking

Knowledge of Google Data Studio, Power BI

A degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics or other relevant discipline.

Special Conditions

Some out of hours work may be required.

Recommended applicants are subject to satisfactory criminal history check in accordance with the DTF Pre-Employment Screening Policy and Procedure and every three years thereafter.

Remuneration

ASO8 - $114,105 - $118,413 p.a.

Application Instructions

All applications must be submitted online via I Work For SA.

Applicants are required to submit a curriculum vitae and written application of no more than 2 pages, demonstrating their suitability against the essential minimum requirements of the Job and Person Specification. Applicants are to include the name and contact number of two referees.

All applications are to be submitted by 5.00pm on closing date.

Contact and Queries

Caroline Patrick

Director, Brand and Member Engagement

Email: SuperJobs@sa.gov.au

Phone: 8226 7332

Diversity Statement

The Department of Treasury and Finance actively promote flexible working arrangements, and is committed to having at least 50% of interviewees for each role being women. At DTF we value and encourage diversity within our workforce, to help us reflect the community we serve.

Applications Close

23/08/2020 5:00 PM

employment declaration.pdf

ExtraHop hiring Solutions Architect, Sid.job_description:
ExtraHop’s Solutions Architecture

 team is very different from many other post-sales services practices—we focus on outcomes and customer success rather than racking up billable hours. As a member of our Solutions Architecture team, you’ll play a critical role in the success of our customers, products, and position in the marketplace. Our Architects tackle the most difficult business and technology problems across a vast array of industries and technologies. As a Solutions Architect at ExtraHop, you will never be bored again.

Conduct deep technical and business discovery sessions with Fortune 500 customers and develop creative solutions to challenges uncovered.

Analyze customer network topologies and application stacks; develop strategies to acquire high-value data from the wire.

Profile industry-specific applications across a broad range of verticals; create technical assets and written collateral to support product improvement and marketing efforts.

Conduct root causes analysis of high-profile technology problems and advises customers on their resolution.

Develop custom tools using product APIs to extend the functionality of the ExtraHop platform.

Develop customized data analysis to monitor changing technical and business conditions in real-time.

Create rich data visualizations to aid tactical investigations and realize strategic objectives.

Design and implement ExtraHop product deployments to maximize time-to-value and ongoing positive technical outcomes.

Create automated tools to streamline repeatable processes and maximize time spent building intelligent solutions.

Conduct hands-on learning sessions with key customer personnel.

Qualifications And Experience

We’re looking for a Solutions Architect who can help us grow to the next level as a company. As a starting point for this position, you’ll need the following background:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in computer science, engineering, or information technology

Minimum of 4 years of experience in Information Technology, particularly networking and systems administration

Experience in customer-facing positions; excellent interpersonal skills

Understanding of core networking principles (layers 2 through 4 of the OSI model) and application protocols (HTTP, SQL, CIFS/NFS, HL7, Memcache, DNS)

Familiarity with principles of internetworked applications and related technologies (HTTP, databases, caching, distributed systems, etc)

Experience with scripting languages such as Python and JavaScript

Excellent written communication skills

Independence, motivation, and desire for practice ownership

Desirable Skills

Familiarity with network security, IDS, and SIEM technologies

Familiarity with security frameworks such as MITRE ATT&CK, NIST, or CIS Controls

Ability to adapt to different enterprise security requirements

Ability to communicate security hygiene best-practices.

About Extrahop

ExtraHop is an enterprise cyber analytics and performance monitoring company helping the world’s leading organizations understand and secure their entire environment from the core to edge to the cloud. Our breakthrough approach to analytics and machine learning helps our customers investigate threats, ensure the delivery of critical applications, and secure their investment in the cloud, resulting in 95% faster threat detection and reducing unplanned downtime by 86% while providing the best possible customer experience.

ExtraHop is recognized by leading organizations for both its innovation in the market and its commitment to building a world-class team. We’ve been named to Wealthfront’s Career-Launching Companies list for the last four years, and JMP Securities put ExtraHop on its 2019 Elite 80 List as one of the most strategically positioned private companies in the cybersecurity industry. Credit Suisse recognized ExtraHop as a member of its inaugural Disruptive Technology Recognition Program, and SC Media named ExtraHop a 2019 Industry Innovator for enterprise network traffic analysis.

With well over $150 million in bookings in 2019 and 40% year-over-year growth for the last two consecutive years, the opportunity with ExtraHop has never been greater. Are you ready to rise above the noise?

ExtraHop is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, military status, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law.

Australian Red Cross Lifeblood hiring Cl.job_description:
New and developing team – make a big impact

Broad range of Cloud Tech and skills to work on

St Kilda Road, Melbourne, VIC

Lifeblood is an essential service. Although, as a nation, we are limited to non-essential activities, Lifeblood is still hiring. Even though your onboarding experience may be different from the norm, we’re still working hard to provide the greatest experience we can.

About Australian Red Cross Lifeblood

At Lifeblood, we’re here for all Australians. And although our life-giving role started over 90 years ago with blood, today we support more people in more ways than ever before.

We also help to facilitate the donation of tissue, organs, breast milk, and other life-giving biological products. Plus, we deliver world-class research and provide expertise in diagnostic, transplantation and other clinical services.

Everyone at Lifeblood is united through the power of humanity to build a healthier nation.

About The Role

We’re looking to add a talented and driven Cloud Engineer to our new Cloud Enablement team. This is a great opportunity to work across a broad range of Cloud technology and skills, in a company that supports learning and development. The journey of moving our services into the Cloud has started and will accelerate in the coming months with the onboarding of this role.

As a fully in-sourced ICT division you will get to work across a range of requirements. This will mean ensuring our systems are running securely, reliably and seamlessly in a hybrid Cloud environment. Working closely with other members of the CloudOps team, you will also be imbedded in projects as a subject matter expert and will need to build strong internal and external relationships as a consequence.

To see if this role has what you are looking for please read through the attached Role Statement for a full understanding of the accountabilities.

This is a permanent full-time role within our Cloud Enablement & Data Engineering team. You will report in to the Cloud Technical Lead and will be based at our St Kilda Road Office in Melbourne (although we are currently working from home).

Skills And Capabilities

 A robust working knowledge of AWS and/or Azure cloud platform services

 Strong experience from a system engineer or application development background

 Experienced with DevOps practices, specifically CI/CD and infrastructure-as-Code

 Skills to implement & manage orchestration tools & automation of the full technical stack

 Fluent in one or more of the following scripting platforms: Python, NodeJS, PowerShell or Bash & tools such as Ansible or Terraform

 Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate both technical and abstract concepts in a clear and concise manner

 Please read the attached Role Statement for a full list of requirements

Benefits

 Salary packaging programs which allow you to make the most of your salary

 Rewards program offering discounts on movies, groceries, food and beverage, department stores, and travel and leisure

 Discounted health insurance, veterinary care and car hire

 Internal programs focused on your wellbeing and safety

If you’re getting excited about working with us, we’d love for you to apply.

Next steps

We’re a fast-paced business, so we aim to progress suitable candidates through the hiring process as soon as we receive applications. This may mean the role is filled prior to the advertising close date.

We strive for an inclusive environment where people from diverse backgrounds and perspectives are respected, connected, and able to contribute to the best of their ability, with equal access to opportunities and resources.

As part of our recruitment process, you’ll be required to complete and clear a national criminal history check, employment history check, and a validation of Australian working rights.

For further details on this position please contact Jono Greensides at jgreensides@redcrossblood.org.au

While we appreciate all interest in our business, we won’t engage with or accept candidates from agencies or consulting firms on this occasion.

Flexible Work Environment

Self Manage & Innovate

This is a rare opportunity to join a well-established global business based in Australia that has large data sets for you to work with.

This is a growth area for the organisation and will be a stand-alone role initially with the opportunity to hire one or two junior data scientists for you to manage and develop in 12-18 months time. It's an exciting time to be joining a business going through a growth phase you will be given the freedom and flexibility to be output-driven, manage your own time and work autonomously amid the launch of the ML and AI tech product. About us

Boeing Defence Australia is shaping the future of tactical communications and networking by delivering some of the nation's most important programs for the Australian Defence Force.

Joining us is a chance to make your mark, working with a diverse team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.

We currently employ more than 2,500 people across 14 sites in Australia and three international locations and have a range of opportunities available as we plan for future growth.

The Opportunity

We are seeking a talented Senior Software Engineer to work as part of the team to support the delivery of the next generation Battle Space Communications System to the Australian Defence Force. The role is based in Brisbane.

Responsibilities

Contribute to the development of innovative networking and communications solutions with a focus on cyber security, scalability and performance

Design, development, integration and test of integrated hardware and software systems

Experience/Qualifications

Tertiary degree with a minimum of 5 years' experience in engineering or equivalent technical experience in an electronic discipline (desirable)

Experience within Defence or complex engineering project environments (desirable)

Experience with one or more of the following is desirable:

Implementation of network security or IP networking protocols

Development of embedded Linux network appliances

Linux kernel debugging and kernel development

Linux media frameworks and tools

VoIP telephony configuration and integration (experience with Asterisk desirable)

RoIP configuration and integration (experience with military radios desirable)

Embedded firmware development for microcontrollers

Python programming

C programming

HTML5 / Javascript / Web Development

Penetration / security testing of network appliances

Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements.

Culture

We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. Female applicants, people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent and ex-defence personnel are encouraged to apply.

Benefits

Flexible working options 

Study assistance 

Salary packaging 

Employee Incentive Program 

Global opportunities

How To Apply

If you would like to see your career take off click Apply now.

Animal Logic hiring Senior Crowd Artist.job_description:
Are you a Senior Crowd Artist with creative problem-solving skills in order to fill sets and shots with life for an animated feature? We are looking for a Senior Crowd Artist to join our team in Sydney!

What you'll get to do:

Setup crowd assets and HDAs within the existing Houdini pipeline, and test new procedures and workflows

Create a range of efficient crowd agents (bipeds/quadrupeds and vehicles) for efficient simulation

Work with Animation teams to identify and breakdown behaviours into cycles for artists to use

Work closely with FX Department Supervisor and Crowd Lead to implement efficient and effective ways to fill the sets and shots with life

Give feedback to the department TD's to continue the development of tools and workflows associated with crowd simulation

Build templates that are highly geared towards automation

If required, work with the fellow artists on the show that have been assigned shot implementation, to make sure the scene files are being used efficiently

Evaluate any issues that may arise in the setup of crowd, and devise efficient solutions

Be willing to assist/mentor junior team members with any technical/artistic challenges they may have

What you bring:

5+ years' Houdini experience on feature films, TV and/or animated feature, with a focus in Houdini Crowds

Past experience, demonstrated via reel, of feature animation crowd or effects simulation

Strong understanding of Houdini crowd agent design & setup

Production experience using Houdini: SOPs/DOPs essential

Production experience using Houdini: Vex and Python knowledge desirable

Experience building Houdini digital assets

Solid understanding of motion and principles of rigging and animation

Good understanding of crowd shading and rendering procedurals

Attention to design and artistic detail

Ability to work solo, as well as collaboratively, within a team environment, and when necessary to pass knowledge to other staff members

Excellence in problem solving and balancing quick turnaround with long term quality and ability to meet deadlines with high quality output

Strong written and verbal English language skills

Strong communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to efficiently organise and prioritise work across multiple areas, and work under pressure

Ability to take direction and feedback and apply this to assets or shots moving forward; anticipating the supervisors and leads preference

Q-CTRL hiring Senior Quantum Control Eng.job_description:
About Us 

Quantum technology is likely to be as transformational in the 21st century as harnessing electricity was in the 19th. Quantum computing in particular promises to completely disrupt the way we process information - transforming previously uncomputable problems into manageable ones.

If you build or use quantum hardware, Q-CTRL provides the critical enabling software and professional services to help you achieve maximum performance. We empower our customers to realise the true potential of quantum tech, combining modern product design and engineering with state-of-the-art quantum control engineering techniques. Our ambition is to be the trusted provider of quantum control solutions across all applications of quantum tech.

We’re a venture-capital backed company with Tier-1 investors including Sequoia Capital, DCVC, Sierra Ventures, and InQTel. Q-CTRL operates offices in the US and Australia, but is currently supporting remote work within these jurisdictions due to COVID19.

 About The Role 

Supported by the largest team of quantum control and machine learning experts in the world - already assembled at Q-CTRL - you will help address the toughest hardware challenges facing superconducting quantum computers.

You will develop high-performance characterization and optimization techniques for superconducting devices, informed by your experience operating real devices. You will get to deploy solutions on real hardware to test and verify their effectiveness, and work with customers to integrate into their systems.

This is your chance to solve the difficult problems you wish someone had solved when you ran experiments - poor gate fidelities, drifts, miscalibrations, instabilities, crosstalk, slow and manual tuneup procedures.

 What You'll Do 

Deploy and test quantum control solutions on superconducting qubit hardware.

Develop novel methods to characterize the performance of quantum controls, and also identify noise and errors sources.

Develop new methods for improving the accuracy and precision of measurements made with superconducting devices.

Deploy the latest techniques from machine learning and quantum control on this problem

Develop control solutions for superconducting qubits and deploy them in the Q-CTRL product suite - through research, demonstrations, software development, testing, performance benchmarking, and documentation

Develop publicly available and high quality software using Python

Collaborate with your colleagues in the Quantum Control Engineering and Software Engineering teams

Consult with the Lead Quantum Control Engineer, stakeholders and the broader team on decisions for all new products and features

Communicate your results through publications and documentation to both the team and the wider quantum computing community. Interact with customers as needed to deliver solutions which help them achieve their goals

We would love to hear from you if...

You have a PhD in Physics, Engineering or a closely related discipline.

You have experimental experience with superconducting qubits. Knowledge should include tune-up, calibration, device characterization, measurement, and/or quantum algorithm execution.

You have experience developing software and controlling experiments with Python (not essential, but highly desirable)

Why Q-CTRL?

At Q-CTRL, you can make a difference from day one - you won't be just a cog in the machine. You will work in a fascinating industry where you get to be a part of the 21st century’s most disruptive technology transformation.

You'll get to live the startup life without the startup wages: we offer competitive salaries and potential equity options. We also embrace flexible work hours - worry about your global impact, not a rigid work schedule. We are looking for people as excited as we are about building the quantum future. Join us!

To be considered, all applicants must have full work rights in the work location they have applied for.

To recruitment agencies, we do not accept unsolicited branded profiles and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Q-CTRL hiring Senior Quantum Control Eng.job_description:
About Us 

Quantum technology is likely to be as transformational in the 21st century as harnessing electricity was in the 19th. Quantum computing in particular promises to completely disrupt the way we process information - transforming previously uncomputable problems into manageable ones.

If you build or use quantum hardware, Q-CTRL provides the critical enabling software and professional services to help you achieve maximum performance. We empower our customers to realise the true potential of quantum tech, combining modern product design and engineering with state-of-the-art quantum control engineering techniques. Our ambition is to be the trusted provider of quantum control solutions across all applications of quantum tech.

We’re a venture-capital backed company with Tier-1 investors including Sequoia Capital, DCVC, Sierra Ventures, and InQTel. Q-CTRL operates offices in the US and Australia, but is currently supporting remote work within these jurisdictions due to COVID19.

 About The Role 

Supported by the largest team of quantum control and machine learning experts in the world - already assembled at Q-CTRL - you will determine how to improve the performance of quantum algorithms relevant to real-world problems of commercial interest such as QAOA and VQE. As an algorithms and compilation specialist, you will seek to leverage Q-CTRL capabilities in quantum control and error suppression in order to achieve maximum performance when algorithms are run on real quantum hardware subject to noise and errors.

Responsibilities will include creating novel approaches to the incorporation of error mitigation in quantum algorithms, understanding the application of quantum algorithms to end-users, interacting with high-level abstractions for algorithm development and compilation, and evaluating performance through numerical simulation and experiment on partner hardware. You’ll aim to make quantum algorithms perform on real hardware the way they do in simulation by addressing the biggest challenges in the field.

 What You'll Do 

Develop new approaches to the implementation of quantum algorithms that utilize the latest in quantum control techniques to suppress errors arising in realistic lab environments.

Apply optimization and machine learning techniques for both performance enhancement and analysis

Develop realistic quantum-computer simulation tools to determine the performance of quantum algorithms on real devices, and quantify the expected improvements from use of appropriate quantum control techniques

Support clients and partners by solving real commercial problems using quantum algorithms that are likely to get a quantum advantage with NISQ-era devices.

Deploy solutions in the Q-CTRL product suite - through research, demonstrations, software development, testing, performance benchmarking, and documentation

Develop publicly available and high quality software using Python

Explain and document sophisticated solutions in accessible language

Collaborate with your colleagues in the Quantum Control Engineering and Software Engineering teams

Consult with the Lead Quantum Control Engineer, stakeholders and the broader team on decisions for all new products and features

Communicate your results through publications and documentation to both the team and the wider quantum computing community. 

We would love to hear from you if...

You have a PhD in Physics, Engineering, CS or a closely related discipline.

You have a background in quantum algorithms, applications, and compilation

You have run quantum algorithms on real devices.

Have developed software in Python (highly desirable, but not essential) 

Why Q-CTRL?

At Q-CTRL, you can make a difference from day one - you won't be just a cog in the machine. You will work in a fascinating industry where you get to be a part of the 21st century’s most disruptive technology transformation.

You'll get to live the startup life without the startup wages: we offer competitive salaries and potential equity options. We also embrace flexible work hours - worry about your global impact, not a rigid work schedule. We are looking for people as excited as we are about building the quantum future. Join us!

To be considered, all applicants must have full work rights in the work location they have applied for.

To recruitment agencies, we do not accept unsolicited branded profiles and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
